page.title: 16Bashley.
page.content: Bashley is a linear village of less than 150 houses stretched mainly along the busy and narrow B3058 on the edge of the New Forest. The village has one church, St John's, two village halls, a village store and post office, a garage, a riding school, a sports field, two residential caravan parks, two saw mills, several farms, nurseries and orchards and two chalet and caravan holiday parks. The village has no public house, a bus service only on Saturdays and Tuesdays and no school. Most children in the village travel to schools in New Milton. In the grounds of the Bashley House Private Hotel is an avenue of beech trees complete with an ornamental well.
